00001 /**
00002  * \file Geodesic.cpp
00003  * \brief Implementation for GeographicLib::Geodesic class
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * This is a reformulation of the geodesic problem.  The notation is as
00010  * follows:
00011  * - at a general point (no suffix or 1 or 2 as suffix)
00012  *   - phi = latitude
00013  *   - beta = latitude on auxiliary sphere
00014  *   - omega = longitude on auxiliary sphere
00015  *   - lambda = longitude
00016  *   - alpha = azimuth of great circle
00017  *   - sigma = arc length along greate circle
00018  *   - s = distance
00019  *   - tau = scaled distance (= sigma at multiples of pi/2)
00020  * - at northwards equator crossing
00021  *   - beta = phi = 0
00022  *   - omega = lambda = 0
00023  *   - alpha = alpha0
00024  *   - sigma = s = 0
00025  * - a 12 suffix means a difference, e.g., s12 = s2 - s1.
00026  * - s and c prefixes mean sin and cos
00027  **********************************************************************/
00028 
00029 #include "GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp"
00030 
00031 #define GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_CPP "$Id: Geodesic.cpp 6785 2010-01-05 22:15:42Z karney $"
00032 
00033 RCSID_DECL(GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_CPP)
00034 RCSID_DECL(GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_HPP)
00035 
00036 namespace GeographicLib {

00038   using namespace std;
00039 
00040   // Underflow guard.  We require
00041   //   eps2 * epsilon() > 0
00042   //   eps2 + epsilon() == epsilon()
00043   const Math::real Geodesic::eps2 = sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::min());
00044   const Math::real Geodesic::tol0 = numeric_limits<real>::epsilon();
00045   const Math::real Geodesic::tol1 = 100 * tol0;
00046   const Math::real Geodesic::tol2 = sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::epsilon());
00047   const Math::real Geodesic::xthresh = 1000 * tol2;
00048 
00049   Geodesic::Geodesic(real a, real r)
00050     : _a(a)
00051     , _r(r)
00052     , _f(_r != 0 ? 1 / _r : 0)
00053     , _f1(1 - _f)
00054     , _e2(_f * (2 - _f))
00055     , _ep2(_e2 / sq(_f1))       // e2 / (1 - e2)
00056     , _n(_f / ( 2 - _f))
00057     , _b(_a * _f1)
00058   {
00059     if (!(_a > 0))
00060       throw GeographicErr("Major radius is not positive");
00061   }
00062 
00063   const Geodesic Geodesic::WGS84(Constants::WGS84_a(), Constants::WGS84_r());
00064 
00065   Math::real Geodesic::SinSeries(real sinx, real cosx,
00066                                  const real c[], int n) throw() {
00067     // Evaluate y = sum(c[i - 1] * sin(2 * i * x), i, 1, n) using Clenshaw
00068     // summation.  (Indices into c offset by 1.)
00069     // Approx operation count = (n + 5) mult and (2 * n + 2) add
00070     real
00071       ar = 2 * (cosx - sinx) * (cosx + sinx), // 2 * cos(2 * x)
00072       y0 = n & 1 ? c[--n] : 0, y1 = 0;        // Accumulators for sum
00073     // Now n is even
00074     while (n) {
00075       // Unroll loop x 2, so accumulators return to their original role
00076       y1 = ar * y0 - y1 + c[--n];
00077       y0 = ar * y1 - y0 + c[--n];
00078     }
00079     return 2 * sinx * cosx * y0; // sin(2 * x) * y0
00080   }

00083     return GeodesicLine(*this, lat1, lon1, azi1);
00084   }

00086   Math::real Geodesic::Direct(real lat1, real lon1, real azi1, real s12,
00087                               real& lat2, real& lon2, real& azi2, real& m12,
00088                               bool arcmode) const throw() {
00089     GeodesicLine l(*this, lat1, lon1, azi1);
00090     return l.Position(s12, lat2, lon2, azi2, m12, arcmode);
00091   }

00093   Math::real Geodesic::Inverse(real lat1, real lon1, real lat2, real lon2,
00094                                real& s12, real& azi1, real& azi2, real& m12)
00095     const throw() {
00096     lon1 = AngNormalize(lon1);
00097     real lon12 = AngNormalize(AngNormalize(lon2) - lon1);
00098     // If very close to being on the same meridian, then make it so.
00099     // Not sure this is necessary...
00100     lon12 = AngRound(lon12);
00101     // Make longitude difference positive.
00102     int lonsign = lon12 >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
00103     lon12 *= lonsign;
00104     if (lon12 == 180)
00105       lonsign = 1;
00106     // If really close to the equator, treat as on equator.
00107     lat1 = AngRound(lat1);
00108     lat2 = AngRound(lat2);
00109     // Swap points so that point with higher (abs) latitude is point 1
00110     int swapp = abs(lat1) >= abs(lat2) ? 1 : -1;
00111     if (swapp < 0) {
00112       lonsign *= -1;
00113       swap(lat1, lat2);
00114     }
00115     // Make lat1 <= 0
00116     int latsign = lat1 < 0 ? 1 : -1;
00117     lat1 *= latsign;
00118     lat2 *= latsign;
00119     // Now we have
00120     //
00121     //     0 <= lon12 <= 180
00122     //     -90 <= lat1 <= 0
00123     //     lat1 <= lat2 <= -lat1
00124     //
00125     // longsign, swapp, latsign register the transformation to bring the
00126     // coordinates to this canonical form.  In all cases, 1 means no change was
00127     // made.  We make these transformations so that there are few cases to
00128     // check, e.g., on verifying quadrants in atan2.  In addition, this
00129     // enforces some symmetries in the results returned.
00130 
00131     real phi, sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2;
00132 
00133     phi = lat1 * Constants::degree();
00134     // Ensure cbet1 = +eps at poles
00135     sbet1 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00136     cbet1 = lat1 == -90 ? eps2 : cos(phi);
00137     SinCosNorm(sbet1, cbet1);
00138 
00139     phi = lat2 * Constants::degree();
00140     // Ensure cbet2 = +eps at poles
00141     sbet2 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00142     cbet2 = abs(lat2) == 90 ? eps2 : cos(phi);
00143     SinCosNorm(sbet2, cbet2);
00144 
00145     real
00146       lam12 = lon12 * Constants::degree(),
00147       slam12 = lon12 == 180 ? 0 :sin(lam12),
00148       clam12 = cos(lam12);      // lon12 == 90 isn't interesting
00149 
00150     real sig12, calp1, salp1, calp2, salp2;
00151     real tc[ntau ? ntau : 1], zc[nzet ? nzet : 1], ec[neta ? neta : 1];
00152 
00153     bool meridian = lat1 == -90 || slam12 == 0;
00154 
00155     if (meridian) {
00156 
00157       // Endpoints are on a single full meridian, so the geodesic might lie on
00158       // a meridian.
00159 
00160       calp1 = clam12; salp1 = slam12; // Head to the target longitude
00161       calp2 = 1; salp2 = 0;     // At the target we're heading north
00162 
00163       real
00164         // tan(bet) = tan(sig) * cos(alp),
00165         ssig1 = sbet1, csig1 = calp1 * cbet1,
00166         ssig2 = sbet2, csig2 = calp2 * cbet2;
00167 
00168       // sig12 = sig2 - sig1
00169       sig12 = atan2(max(csig1 * ssig2 - ssig1 * csig2, real(0)),
00170                     csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2);
00171       {
00172         real dummy;
00173         Lengths(_n, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00174                 cbet1, cbet2, s12, m12, dummy, tc, zc);
00175       }
00176       // Add the check for sig12 since zero length geodesics might yield m12 <
00177       // 0.  Test case was
00178       //
00179       //    echo 20.001 0 20.001 0 | Geod -i
00180       //
00181       // In fact, we will have sig12 > pi/2 for meridional geodesic which is
00182       // not a shortest path.
00183       if (sig12 < 1 || m12 >= 0) {
00184         m12 *= _a;
00185         s12 *= _b;
00186         sig12 /= Constants::degree();
00187       } else
00188         // m12 < 0, i.e., prolate and too close to anti-podal
00189         meridian = false;
00190     }
00191 
00192     if (!meridian &&
00193         sbet1 == 0 &&   // and sbet2 == 0
00194          // Mimic the way Lambda12 works with calp1 = 0
00195         (_f <= 0 || lam12 <= Constants::pi() - _f * Constants::pi())) {
00196 
00197       // Geodesic runs along equator
00198       calp1 = calp2 = 0; salp1 = salp2 = 1;
00199       s12 = _a * lam12;
00200       m12 = _b * sin(lam12 / _f1);
00201       sig12 = lon12 / _f1;
00202 
00203     } else if (!meridian) {
00204 
00205       // Now point1 and point2 belong within a hemisphere bounded by a
00206       // meridian and geodesic is neither meridional or equatorial.
00207 
00208       // Figure a starting point for Newton's method
00209       InverseStart(sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2,
00210                    lam12, slam12, clam12, salp1, calp1, tc, zc);
00211 
00212       // Newton's method
00213       real ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2, k1;
00214       real ov = 0;
00215       unsigned numit = 0;
00216       for (unsigned trip = 0; numit < maxit; ++numit) {
00217         real dv;
00218         real v = Lambda12(sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2, salp1, calp1,
00219                             salp2, calp2, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00220                             k1, trip < 1, dv, tc, zc, ec) - lam12;
00221 
00222         if (abs(v) <= eps2 || !(trip < 1)) {
00223           if (abs(v) > max(tol1, ov))
00224             numit = maxit;
00225           break;
00226         }
00227         real
00228           dalp1 = -v/dv;
00229         real
00230           sdalp1 = sin(dalp1), cdalp1 = cos(dalp1),
00231           nsalp1 = salp1 * cdalp1 + calp1 * sdalp1;
00232         calp1 = calp1 * cdalp1 - salp1 * sdalp1;
00233         salp1 = max(real(0), nsalp1);
00234         SinCosNorm(salp1, calp1);
00235         // In some regimes we don't get quadratic convergence because slope ->
00236         // 0.  So use convergernce conditions based on epsilon instead of
00237         // sqrt(epsilon).  The first criterion is a test on abs(v) against 100
00238         // * epsilon.  The second takes credit for an anticipated reduction in
00239         // abs(v) by v/ov (due to the latest update in alp1) and checks this
00240         // against epsilon.
00241         if (abs(v) < tol1 || sq(v) < ov * tol0) ++trip;
00242         ov = abs(v);
00243       }
00244 
00245       {
00246         real dummy;
00247         Lengths(k1, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00248                 cbet1, cbet2, s12, m12, dummy, tc, zc);
00249       }
00250       m12 *= _a;
00251       s12 *= _b;
00252       sig12 /= Constants::degree();
00253 
00254       if (numit >= maxit) {
00255         // Signal failure to converge by negating the distance and azimuths.
00256         s12 *= -1; sig12 *= -1; m12 *= -1;
00257         salp1 *= -1; calp1 *= -1;
00258         salp2 *= -1; calp2 *= -1;
00259       }
00260     }
00261 
00262     // Convert calp, salp to azimuth accounting for lonsign, swapp, latsign.
00263     if (swapp < 0) {
00264       swap(salp1, salp2);
00265       swap(calp1, calp2);
00266     }
00267 
00268     // minus signs give range [-180, 180). 0- converts -0 to +0.
00269     azi1 = 0 - atan2(- swapp * lonsign * salp1,
00270                      + swapp * latsign * calp1) / Constants::degree();
00271     azi2 = 0 - atan2(- swapp * lonsign * salp2,
00272                      + swapp * latsign * calp2) / Constants::degree();
00273     // Returned value in [0, 180], unless it's negated to signal convergence
00274     // failure
00275     return sig12;
00276   }
00277 
00278   void Geodesic::Lengths(real k1, real sig12,
00279                          real ssig1, real csig1, real ssig2, real csig2,
00280                          real cbet1, real cbet2,
00281                          real& s12b, real& m12a, real& m0,
00282                          real tc[], real zc[]) const throw() {
00283     // Return m12a = (reduced length)/_a; also calculate s12b = distance/_b,
00284     // and m0 = coefficient of secular term in expression for reduced length.
00285     tauCoeff(k1, tc);
00286     zetCoeff(k1, zc);
00287     real
00288       taufm1 = tauFactorm1(k1),
00289       et = (1 + taufm1) * (SinSeries(ssig2, csig2, tc, ntau) -
00290                            SinSeries(ssig1, csig1, tc, ntau)),
00291       zetfm1 = zetFactorm1(k1),
00292       ez = (1 + zetfm1) * (SinSeries(ssig2, csig2, zc, nzet) -
00293                            SinSeries(ssig1, csig1, zc, nzet));
00294     m0 = taufm1 - zetfm1;
00295     // Missing a factor of _a.
00296     // Add parens around (csig1 * ssig2) and (ssig1 * csig2) to ensure accurate
00297     // cancellation in the case of coincident points.
00298     m12a = (sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet2)) * (csig1 * ssig2) -
00299             sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1)) * (ssig1 * csig2))
00300       - _f1 * csig1 * csig2 * ( m0 * sig12 + (et - ez) );
00301     // Missing a factor of _b
00302     s12b =  (1 + taufm1) * sig12 + et;
00303   }
00304 
00305   void Geodesic::Evolute(real R, real z, real& s, real& c) throw() {
00306     // Solve (R - cos(phi)) * sin(phi) - z * cos(phi) = 0 for phi.  This is
00307     // adapted from Geocentric::Reverse, taking e^2 -> 0 and a * e^2 -> 1 and
00308     // scaling all variables to e^2.
00309     real
00310       p = sq(R),                // *e^4
00311       q = sq(z),                // *e^4
00312       r = (p + q - 1) / 6;      // *e^4
00313     if ( !(q == 0 && r <= 0) ) {
00314       real
00315         // Avoid possible division by zero when r = 0 by multiplying
00316         // equations for s and t by r^3 and r, resp.
00317         S = p * q / 4,          // *e^12 ... S = r^3 * s
00318         r2 = sq(r),             // *e^8
00319         r3 = r * r2,            // *e^12
00320         disc =  S * (2 * r3 + S); // *e^24
00321       real u = r;                 // *e^4
00322       if (disc >= 0) {
00323         real T3 = r3 + S;       // *e^12
00324         // Pick the sign on the sqrt to maximize abs(T3).  This minimizes
00325         // loss of precision due to cancellation.  The result is unchanged
00326         // because of the way the T is used in definition of u.
00327         T3 += T3 < 0 ? -sqrt(disc) : sqrt(disc); // T3 = (r * t)^3
00328         // N.B. cbrt always returns the real root.  cbrt(-8) = -2.
00329         real T = Math::cbrt(T3); // T = r * t
00330         // T can be zero; but then r2 / T -> 0.
00331         u += T + (T != 0 ? r2 / T : 0);
00332       } else {
00333         // T is complex, but the way u is defined the result is real.
00334         real ang = atan2(sqrt(-disc), r3 + S);
00335         // There are three possible real solutions for u depending on the
00336         // multiple of 2*pi here.  We choose multiplier = 1 which leads to a
00337         // jump in the solution across the line 2 + s = 0; but this
00338         // nevertheless leads to a continuous (and accurate) solution for k.
00339         // Other choices of the multiplier lead to poorly conditioned
00340         // solutions near s = 0 (i.e., near p = 0 or q = 0).
00341         u += 2 * abs(r) * cos((2 * Constants::pi() + ang) / real(3));
00342       }
00343       real
00344         v = sqrt(sq(u) + q),    // *e^4 guaranteed positive
00345         // Avoid loss of accuracy when u < 0.  Underflow doesn't occur in
00346         // e4 * q / (v - u) because u ~ e^4 when q is small and u < 0.
00347         uv = u < 0 ? q / (v - u) : u + v, // *e^4... u+v, guaranteed positive
00348         // Need to guard against w going negative due to roundoff in uv - q.
00349         w = max(real(0), (uv - q) / (2 * v)), // *e^2
00350         // Rearrange expression for k to avoid loss of accuracy due to
00351         // subtraction.  Division by 0 not possible because uv > 0, w >= 0.
00352         k = uv / (sqrt(uv + sq(w)) + w),   // *e^2 ... guaranteed positive
00353         d = k * R / (k + 1);               // *e^0
00354       s = z;
00355       c = d;
00356     } else {                    // q == 0 && r <= 0
00357       // Very near equatorial plane with R <= a * e^2.  This leads to k = 0
00358       // using the general formula and division by 0 in formula for h.  So
00359       // handle this case directly.
00360       s = sqrt( -6 * r);
00361       c = sqrt(p);
00362     }
00363     SinCosNorm(s, c);
00364   }
00365 
00366   void Geodesic::InverseStart(real sbet1, real cbet1, real sbet2, real cbet2,
00367                               real lam12, real slam12, real clam12,
00368                               real& salp1, real& calp1,
00369                               real tc[], real zc[]) const throw() {
00370     // Figure a starting point for Newton's method
00371     real
00372       // How close to antipodal lat?
00373       // bet12 = bet2 - bet1 in [0, pi);  bet12a = bet2 + bet1 in (-pi, 0]
00374       sbet12 = sbet2 * cbet1 - cbet2 * sbet1,
00375       sbet12a = sbet2 * cbet1 + cbet2 * sbet1;
00376 
00377     salp1 = cbet2 * slam12;
00378     // For short lines we have
00379     //
00380     //    dy = (1 - e2) * n^3 * dphi
00381     //    dx = cos(phi) * n * dlam
00382     //    n = 1/sqrt(1-e2*sin(phi)^2)
00383     //
00384     // or in terms of reduced latitude
00385     //
00386     //    dy = sqrt(1 - e2) * n * dbeta = sqrt(1 - e2 * cos(beta)^2) * dbeta
00387     //    dx = cos(beta) * dlam
00388     //
00389     // The factor
00390     //
00391     //    sqrt(1 - e2 * sq(cbet1))
00392     //
00393     // applies the ellipsoidal correction for close points.  This saves 1
00394     // iteration of Newton's method in the case of short lines.
00395     calp1 = clam12 >= 0 ?
00396       sbet12 * (slam12 < real(0.1) ? sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1)) : real(1))
00397       + cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(slam12) / (1 + clam12) :
00398       sbet12a - cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(slam12) / (1 - clam12);
00399 
00400     real
00401       ssig12 = Math::hypot(salp1, calp1),
00402       csig12 = sbet1 * sbet2 + cbet1 * cbet2 * clam12;
00403 
00404     if (csig12 >= 0 || ssig12 >= 3 * abs(_f) * Constants::pi() * sq(cbet1)) {
00405       // Nothing to do, zeroth order spherical approximation is OK
00406     } else {
00407       // Scale lam12 and bet2 to x, y coordinate system where antipodal point
00408       // is at origin and singular point is at y = 0, x = -1.
00409       real x, y, lamscale, betscale;
00410       if (_f >= 0) {            // In fact f == 0 does not get here
00411         // x = dlong, y = dlat
00412         {
00413           real
00414             mu = sq(sbet1),
00415             u2 = mu * _ep2,
00416             k1 = u2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + u2)) + u2);
00417           lamscale = -cbet1 * etaFactor(_f, k1) * Constants::pi();
00418         }
00419         betscale = lamscale * cbet1;
00420         x = (lam12 - Constants::pi()) / lamscale;
00421         y = sbet12a / betscale;
00422       } else {                  // _f < 0
00423         // x = dlat, y = dlong
00424         real
00425           cbet12a = cbet2 * cbet1 - sbet2 * sbet1,
00426           bet12a = atan2(sbet12a, cbet12a);
00427         real m0, dummy;
00428         etaCoeff(_f, _n, zc);
00429         // In the case of lon12 = 180, this repeats a calculation made in
00430         // Inverse.
00431         Lengths(_n, Constants::pi() + bet12a, sbet1, -cbet1, sbet2, cbet2,
00432                 cbet1, cbet2, dummy, x, m0, tc, zc);
00433         x = -1 + x/(_f1 * cbet1 * cbet2 * m0 * Constants::pi());
00434         betscale = x < -real(0.01) ? sbet12a / x :
00435           -_f * sq(cbet1) * Constants::pi();
00436         lamscale = betscale / cbet1;
00437         y = (lam12 - Constants::pi()) / lamscale;
00438       }
00439 
00440       if (y > -100 * tol1 && x >  -1 - xthresh) {
00441         // strip near cut
00442         if (_f >= 0) {
00443           salp1 = min(real( 1), -x); calp1 = - sqrt(1 - sq(salp1));
00444         } else {
00445           calp1 = max(real(-1),  x); salp1 =   sqrt(1 - sq(calp1));
00446         }
00447       } else {
00448         // Estimate alp2, by solving calp2 * (salp2 + x) - y * salp2 = 0.  (For
00449         // f < 0, we're solving for pi/2 - alp2 and calp2 and salp2 are
00450         // swapped.)
00451         real salp2, calp2;
00452         // Note phi = 90 - alpha2, so swap salp2 and calp2
00453         Evolute(-x, -y, calp2, salp2);
00454         // estimate omg12a = pi - omg12
00455         real
00456           omg12a = lamscale * ( _f >= 0
00457                                 ? Math::hypot(y,  salp2 + x) * salp2
00458                                 : Math::hypot(x, -calp2 + y) * calp2 ),
00459           somg12 = sin(omg12a), comg12 = -cos(omg12a);
00460         // Update spherical estimate of alp1 using omg12 instead of lam12
00461         salp1 = cbet2 * somg12;
00462         calp1 = sbet12a - cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(somg12) / (1 - comg12);
00463       }
00464     }
00465     SinCosNorm(salp1, calp1);
00466   }
00467 
00468   Math::real Geodesic::Lambda12(real sbet1, real cbet1, real sbet2, real cbet2,
00469                                 real salp1, real calp1,
00470                                 real& salp2, real& calp2,
00471                                 real& sig12,
00472                                 real& ssig1, real& csig1,
00473                                 real& ssig2, real& csig2,
00474                                 real& k1, bool diffp, real& dlam12,
00475                                 real tc[], real zc[], real ec[]) const throw() {
00476 
00477     if (sbet1 == 0 && calp1 == 0)
00478       // Break degeneracy of equatorial line.  This cases has already been
00479       // handled.
00480       calp1 = -eps2;
00481 
00482     real
00483       // sin(alp1) * cos(bet1) = sin(alp0),
00484       salp0 = salp1 * cbet1,
00485       calp0 = Math::hypot(calp1, salp1 * sbet1); // calp0 > 0
00486 
00487     real somg1, comg1, somg2, comg2, omg12, lam12, mu, u2;
00488     // tan(bet1) = tan(sig1) * cos(alp1)
00489     // tan(omg1) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig1) = tan(omg1)=tan(alp1)*sin(bet1)
00490     ssig1 = sbet1; somg1 = salp0 * sbet1;
00491     csig1 = comg1 = calp1 * cbet1;
00492     SinCosNorm(ssig1, csig1);
00493     SinCosNorm(somg1, comg1);
00494 
00495     // Enforce symmetries in the case abs(bet2) = -bet1.  Need to be careful
00496     // about this case, since this can yield singularities in the Newton
00497     // iteration.
00498     // sin(alp2) * cos(bet2) = sin(alp0),
00499     salp2 = cbet2 != cbet1 ? salp0 / cbet2 : salp1;
00500     // calp2 = sqrt(1 - sq(salp2))
00501     //       = sqrt(sq(calp0) - sq(sbet2)) / cbet2
00502     // and subst for calp0 and rearrange to give (choose positive sqrt
00503     // to give alp2 in [0, pi/2]).
00504     calp2 = cbet2 != cbet1 || abs(sbet2) != -sbet1 ?
00505       sqrt(sq(calp1 * cbet1) + (cbet1 < -sbet1 ?
00506                                 (cbet2 - cbet1) * (cbet1 + cbet2) :
00507                                 (sbet1 - sbet2) * (sbet1 + sbet2))) / cbet2 :
00508       abs(calp1);
00509     // tan(bet2) = tan(sig2) * cos(alp2)
00510     // tan(omg2) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig2).
00511     ssig2 = sbet2; somg2 = salp0 * sbet2;
00512     csig2 = comg2 = calp2 * cbet2;
00513     SinCosNorm(ssig2, csig2);
00514     SinCosNorm(somg2, comg2);
00515 
00516     // sig12 = sig2 - sig1, limit to [0, pi]
00517     sig12 = atan2(max(csig1 * ssig2 - ssig1 * csig2, real(0)),
00518                   csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2);
00519 
00520     // omg12 = omg2 - omg1, limit to [0, pi]
00521     omg12 = atan2(max(comg1 * somg2 - somg1 * comg2, real(0)),
00522                   comg1 * comg2 + somg1 * somg2);
00523     real eta12, h0;
00524     mu = sq(calp0);
00525     u2 = mu * _ep2;
00526     k1 = u2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + u2)) + u2);
00527     etaCoeff(_f, k1, ec);
00528     eta12 = (SinSeries(ssig2, csig2, ec, neta) -
00529              SinSeries(ssig1, csig1, ec, neta));
00530     h0 = etaFactor(_f, k1),
00531     lam12 = omg12 + salp0 * h0 * (sig12 + eta12);
00532 
00533     if (diffp) {
00534       if (calp2 == 0)
00535         dlam12 = - 2 * sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1)) / sbet1;
00536       else {
00537         real dummy1, dummy2;
00538         Lengths(k1, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00539                 cbet1, cbet2, dummy1, dlam12, dummy2, tc, zc);
00540         dlam12 /= calp2 * cbet2;
00541       }
00542     }
00543 
00544     return lam12;
00545   }
00546 
00547   GeodesicLine::GeodesicLine(const Geodesic& g,
00548                              real lat1, real lon1, real azi1) throw()
00549     : _a(g._a)
00550     , _r(g._r)
00551     , _b(g._b)
00552     , _f1(g._f1)
00553   {
00554     azi1 = Geodesic::AngNormalize(azi1);
00555     // Guard against underflow in salp0
00556     azi1 = Geodesic::AngRound(azi1);
00557     lon1 = Geodesic::AngNormalize(lon1);
00558     _lat1 = lat1;
00559     _lon1 = lon1;
00560     _azi1 = azi1;
00561     // alp1 is in [0, pi]
00562     real
00563       alp1 = azi1 * Constants::degree(),
00564       // Enforce sin(pi) == 0 and cos(pi/2) == 0.  Better to face the ensuing
00565       // problems directly than to skirt them.
00566       salp1 = azi1 == -180 ? 0 : sin(alp1),
00567       calp1 = azi1 ==   90 ? 0 : cos(alp1);
00568     real cbet1, sbet1, phi;
00569     phi = lat1 * Constants::degree();
00570     // Ensure cbet1 = +eps at poles
00571     sbet1 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00572     cbet1 = abs(lat1) == 90 ? Geodesic::eps2 : cos(phi);
00573     Geodesic::SinCosNorm(sbet1, cbet1);
00574 
00575     // Evaluate alp0 from sin(alp1) * cos(bet1) = sin(alp0),
00576     _salp0 = salp1 * cbet1; // alp0 in [0, pi/2 - |bet1|]
00577     // Alt: calp0 = hypot(sbet1, calp1 * cbet1).  The following
00578     // is slightly better (consider the case salp1 = 0).
00579     _calp0 = Math::hypot(calp1, salp1 * sbet1);
00580     // Evaluate sig with tan(bet1) = tan(sig1) * cos(alp1).
00581     // sig = 0 is nearest northward crossing of equator.
00582     // With bet1 = 0, alp1 = pi/2, we have sig1 = 0 (equatorial line).
00583     // With bet1 =  pi/2, alp1 = -pi, sig1 =  pi/2
00584     // With bet1 = -pi/2, alp1 =  0 , sig1 = -pi/2
00585     // Evaluate omg1 with tan(omg1) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig1).
00586     // With alp0 in (0, pi/2], quadrants for sig and omg coincide.
00587     // No atan2(0,0) ambiguity at poles sce cbet1 = +eps.
00588     // With alp0 = 0, omg1 = 0 for alp1 = 0, omg1 = pi for alp1 = pi.
00589     _ssig1 = sbet1; _somg1 = _salp0 * sbet1;
00590     _csig1 = _comg1 = sbet1 != 0 || calp1 != 0 ? cbet1 * calp1 : 1;
00591     Geodesic::SinCosNorm(_ssig1, _csig1); // sig1 in (-pi, pi]
00592     Geodesic::SinCosNorm(_somg1, _comg1);
00593 
00594     real mu = sq(_calp0);
00595     _u2 = mu * g._ep2;
00596     real k1 = _u2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + _u2)) + _u2);
00597     _taufm1 =  Geodesic::tauFactorm1(k1);
00598     _zetfm1 =  Geodesic::zetFactorm1(k1);
00599 
00600     Geodesic::tauCoeff(k1, _tauCoeff);
00601     Geodesic::sigCoeff(k1, _sigCoeff);
00602     Geodesic::zetCoeff(k1, _zetCoeff);
00603     Geodesic::etaCoeff(g._f, k1, _etaCoeff);
00604 
00605     _dtau1 = Geodesic::SinSeries(_ssig1, _csig1, _tauCoeff, ntau);
00606     _dzet1 = Geodesic::SinSeries(_ssig1, _csig1, _zetCoeff, nzet);
00607     {
00608       real s = sin(_dtau1), c = cos(_dtau1);
00609       // tau1 = sig1 + dtau1
00610       _stau1 = _ssig1 * c + _csig1 * s;
00611       _ctau1 = _csig1 * c - _ssig1 * s;
00612     }
00613     // Not necessary because sigCoeff reverts tauCoeff
00614     //    _dtau1 = -SinSeries(_stau1, _ctau1, _sigCoeff, nsig);
00615 
00616     _etaf = _salp0 * Geodesic::etaFactor(g._f, k1);
00617     _dlam1 = Geodesic::SinSeries(_ssig1, _csig1, _etaCoeff, neta);
00618   }
00619 
00620   Math::real GeodesicLine::Position(real s12, real& lat2, real& lon2,
00621                                     real& azi2, real& m12, bool arcmode)
00622   const throw() {
00623     if (!Init())
00624       // Uninitialized
00625       return 0;
00626     // Avoid warning about uninitialized dtau2.
00627     real sig12, ssig12, csig12, dtau2 = 0;
00628     if (arcmode) {
00629       // Interpret s12 as spherical arc length
00630       sig12 = s12 * Constants::degree();
00631       real s12a = abs(s12);
00632       s12a -= 180 * floor(s12a / 180);
00633       ssig12 = s12a ==  0 ? 0 : sin(sig12);
00634       csig12 = s12a == 90 ? 0 : cos(sig12);
00635     } else {
00636       // Interpret s12 as distance
00637       real
00638         tau12 = s12 / (_b * (1 + _taufm1)),
00639         s = sin(tau12),
00640         c = cos(tau12);
00641       // tau2 = tau1 + tau12
00642       dtau2 = - Geodesic::SinSeries(_stau1 * c + _ctau1 * s,
00643                                     _ctau1 * c - _stau1 * s,
00644                                     _sigCoeff, nsig);
00645       sig12 = tau12 - (dtau2 - _dtau1);
00646       ssig12 = sin(sig12);
00647       csig12 = cos(sig12);
00648     }
00649 
00650     real omg12, lam12, lon12;
00651     real ssig2, csig2, sbet2, cbet2, somg2, comg2, salp2, calp2;
00652     // sig2 = sig1 + sig12
00653     ssig2 = _ssig1 * csig12 + _csig1 * ssig12;
00654     csig2 = _csig1 * csig12 - _ssig1 * ssig12;
00655     if (arcmode)
00656       dtau2 = Geodesic::SinSeries(ssig2, csig2, _tauCoeff, ntau);
00657     // sin(bet2) = cos(alp0) * sin(sig2)
00658     sbet2 = _calp0 * ssig2;
00659     // Alt: cbet2 = hypot(csig2, salp0 * ssig2);
00660     cbet2 = Math::hypot(_salp0, _calp0 * csig2);
00661     // tan(omg2) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig2)
00662     somg2 = _salp0 * ssig2; comg2 = csig2;  // No need to normalize
00663     // tan(alp0) = cos(sig2)*tan(alp2)
00664     salp2 = _salp0; calp2 = _calp0 * csig2; // No need to normalize
00665     // omg12 = omg2 - omg1
00666     omg12 = atan2(somg2 * _comg1 - comg2 * _somg1,
00667                   comg2 * _comg1 + somg2 * _somg1);
00668     lam12 = omg12 + _etaf *
00669       ( sig12 +
00670         (Geodesic::SinSeries(ssig2, csig2, _etaCoeff, neta)  - _dlam1));
00671     lon12 = lam12 / Constants::degree();
00672     // Can't use AngNormalize because longitude might have wrapped multiple
00673     // times.
00674     lon12 = lon12 - 360 * floor(lon12/360 + real(0.5));
00675     lat2 = atan2(sbet2, _f1 * cbet2) / Constants::degree();
00676     lon2 = Geodesic::AngNormalize(_lon1 + lon12);
00677     // minus signs give range [-180, 180). 0- converts -0 to +0.
00678     azi2 = 0 - atan2(-salp2, calp2) / Constants::degree();
00679 
00680     real
00681       et = (1 + _taufm1) * (dtau2 - _dtau1),
00682       ez = (1 + _zetfm1) * (Geodesic::SinSeries(ssig2, csig2, _zetCoeff, nzet)
00683                             - _dzet1);
00684     // Add parens around (_csig1 * ssig2) and (_ssig1 * csig2) to ensure
00685     // accurate cancellation in the case of coincident points.
00686     m12 = _b * ((sqrt(1 + _u2 * sq( ssig2)) * (_csig1 * ssig2) -
00687                  sqrt(1 + _u2 * sq(_ssig1)) * (_ssig1 * csig2))
00688                 - _csig1 * csig2 * ( (_taufm1-_zetfm1) * sig12 + (et-ez) ));
00689     if (arcmode)
00690       s12 = _b * ((1 + _taufm1) * sig12 + et);
00691 
00692     return arcmode ? s12 : sig12 /  Constants::degree();
00693   }
00694 
00695   // Generated by Maxima on 13:48:48 Thu, 4/23/2009 (GMT-5)
00696   //
00697   // Minor edits have been made: (1) remove trailing spaces; (2) rudimentary
00698   // line-breaking.
00699 
00700   // The scale factor, T-1, to convert tau to s / b
00701   Math::real Geodesic::tauFactorm1(real k1) throw() {
00702     real
00703       k2 = sq(k1),
00704       t;
00705     switch (tauord/2) {
00706     case 0:
00707       t = 0;
00708       break;
00709     case 1:
00710       t = k2/4;
00711       break;
00712     case 2:
00713       t = k2*(k2+16)/64;
00714       break;
00715     case 3:
00716       t = k2*(k2*(k2+4)+64)/256;
00717       break;
00718     case 4:
00719       t = k2*(k2*(k2*(25*k2+64)+256)+4096)/16384;
00720       break;
00721     default:
00722       STATIC_ASSERT(tauord >= 0 && tauord <= 8, "Bad value of tauord");
00723       t = 0;
00724     }
00725     return (t + k1) / (1 - k1);
00726   }
00727 
00728   // Coefficients, t[k], of sine series to convert sigma to tau
00729   void Geodesic::tauCoeff(real k1, real t[]) throw() {
00730     real
00731       k2 = sq(k1),
00732       d = k1;
00733     switch (ntau) {
00734     case 0:
00735       break;
00736     case 1:
00737       t[0] = -d/2;
00738       break;
00739     case 2:
00740       t[0] = -d/2;
00741       d *= k1;
00742       t[1] = -d/16;
00743       break;
00744     case 3:
00745       t[0] = d*(3*k2-8)/16;
00746       d *= k1;
00747       t[1] = -d/16;
00748       d *= k1;
00749       t[2] = -d/48;
00750       break;
00751     case 4:
00752       t[0] = d*(3*k2-8)/16;
00753       d *= k1;
00754       t[1] = d*(k2-2)/32;
00755       d *= k1;
00756       t[2] = -d/48;
00757       d *= k1;
00758       t[3] = -5*d/512;
00759       break;
00760     case 5:
00761       t[0] = d*((6-k2)*k2-16)/32;
00762       d *= k1;
00763       t[1] = d*(k2-2)/32;
00764       d *= k1;
00765       t[2] = d*(9*k2-16)/768;
00766       d *= k1;
00767       t[3] = -5*d/512;
00768       d *= k1;
00769       t[4] = -7*d/1280;
00770       break;
00771     case 6:
00772       t[0] = d*((6-k2)*k2-16)/32;
00773       d *= k1;
00774       t[1] = d*((64-9*k2)*k2-128)/2048;
00775       d *= k1;
00776       t[2] = d*(9*k2-16)/768;
00777       d *= k1;
00778       t[3] = d*(3*k2-5)/512;
00779       d *= k1;
00780       t[4] = -7*d/1280;
00781       d *= k1;
00782       t[5] = -7*d/2048;
00783       break;
00784     case 7:
00785       t[0] = d*(k2*(k2*(19*k2-64)+384)-1024)/2048;
00786       d *= k1;
00787       t[1] = d*((64-9*k2)*k2-128)/2048;
00788       d *= k1;
00789       t[2] = d*((72-9*k2)*k2-128)/6144;
00790       d *= k1;
00791       t[3] = d*(3*k2-5)/512;
00792       d *= k1;
00793       t[4] = d*(35*k2-56)/10240;
00794       d *= k1;
00795       t[5] = -7*d/2048;
00796       d *= k1;
00797       t[6] = -33*d/14336;
00798       break;
00799     case 8:
00800       t[0] = d*(k2*(k2*(19*k2-64)+384)-1024)/2048;
00801       d *= k1;
00802       t[1] = d*(k2*(k2*(7*k2-18)+128)-256)/4096;
00803       d *= k1;
00804       t[2] = d*((72-9*k2)*k2-128)/6144;
00805       d *= k1;
00806       t[3] = d*((96-11*k2)*k2-160)/16384;
00807       d *= k1;
00808       t[4] = d*(35*k2-56)/10240;
00809       d *= k1;
00810       t[5] = d*(9*k2-14)/4096;
00811       d *= k1;
00812       t[6] = -33*d/14336;
00813       d *= k1;
00814       t[7] = -429*d/262144;
00815       break;
00816     default:
00817       STATIC_ASSERT(ntau >= 0 && ntau <= 8, "Bad value of ntau");
00818     }
00819   }

00821   // Coefficients, t'[k], of sine series to convert tau to sigma
00822   void Geodesic::sigCoeff(real k1, real tp[]) throw() {
00823     real
00824       k2 = sq(k1),
00825       d = k1;
00826     switch (nsig) {
00827     case 0:
00828       break;
00829     case 1:
00830       tp[0] = d/2;
00831       break;
00832     case 2:
00833       tp[0] = d/2;
00834       d *= k1;
00835       tp[1] = 5*d/16;
00836       break;
00837     case 3:
00838       tp[0] = d*(16-9*k2)/32;
00839       d *= k1;
00840       tp[1] = 5*d/16;
00841       d *= k1;
00842       tp[2] = 29*d/96;
00843       break;
00844     case 4:
00845       tp[0] = d*(16-9*k2)/32;
00846       d *= k1;
00847       tp[1] = d*(30-37*k2)/96;
00848       d *= k1;
00849       tp[2] = 29*d/96;
00850       d *= k1;
00851       tp[3] = 539*d/1536;
00852       break;
00853     case 5:
00854       tp[0] = d*(k2*(205*k2-432)+768)/1536;
00855       d *= k1;
00856       tp[1] = d*(30-37*k2)/96;
00857       d *= k1;
00858       tp[2] = d*(116-225*k2)/384;
00859       d *= k1;
00860       tp[3] = 539*d/1536;
00861       d *= k1;
00862       tp[4] = 3467*d/7680;
00863       break;
00864     case 6:
00865       tp[0] = d*(k2*(205*k2-432)+768)/1536;
00866       d *= k1;
00867       tp[1] = d*(k2*(4005*k2-4736)+3840)/12288;
00868       d *= k1;
00869       tp[2] = d*(116-225*k2)/384;
00870       d *= k1;
00871       tp[3] = d*(2695-7173*k2)/7680;
00872       d *= k1;
00873       tp[4] = 3467*d/7680;
00874       d *= k1;
00875       tp[5] = 38081*d/61440;
00876       break;
00877     case 7:
00878       tp[0] = d*(k2*((9840-4879*k2)*k2-20736)+36864)/73728;
00879       d *= k1;
00880       tp[1] = d*(k2*(4005*k2-4736)+3840)/12288;
00881       d *= k1;
00882       tp[2] = d*(k2*(8703*k2-7200)+3712)/12288;
00883       d *= k1;
00884       tp[3] = d*(2695-7173*k2)/7680;
00885       d *= k1;
00886       tp[4] = d*(41604-141115*k2)/92160;
00887       d *= k1;
00888       tp[5] = 38081*d/61440;
00889       d *= k1;
00890       tp[6] = 459485*d/516096;
00891       break;
00892     case 8:
00893       tp[0] = d*(k2*((9840-4879*k2)*k2-20736)+36864)/73728;
00894       d *= k1;
00895       tp[1] = d*(k2*((120150-86171*k2)*k2-142080)+115200)/368640;
00896       d *= k1;
00897       tp[2] = d*(k2*(8703*k2-7200)+3712)/12288;
00898       d *= k1;
00899       tp[3] = d*(k2*(1082857*k2-688608)+258720)/737280;
00900       d *= k1;
00901       tp[4] = d*(41604-141115*k2)/92160;
00902       d *= k1;
00903       tp[5] = d*(533134-2200311*k2)/860160;
00904       d *= k1;
00905       tp[6] = 459485*d/516096;
00906       d *= k1;
00907       tp[7] = 109167851*d/82575360;
00908       break;
00909     default:
00910       STATIC_ASSERT(nsig >= 0 && nsig <= 8, "Bad value of nsig");
00911     }
00912   }
00913 
00914   // The scale factor, Z-1
00915   Math::real Geodesic::zetFactorm1(real k1) throw() {
00916     real
00917       k2 = sq(k1),
00918       t;
00919     switch (zetord/2) {
00920     case 0:
00921       t = 0;
00922       break;
00923     case 1:
00924       t = k2/4;
00925       break;
00926     case 2:
00927       t = k2*(9*k2+16)/64;
00928       break;
00929     case 3:
00930       t = k2*(k2*(25*k2+36)+64)/256;
00931       break;
00932     case 4:
00933       t = k2*(k2*(k2*(1225*k2+1600)+2304)+4096)/16384;
00934       break;
00935     default:
00936       STATIC_ASSERT(zetord >= 0 && zetord <= 8, "Bad value of zetord");
00937       t = 0;
00938     }
00939     return t * (1 - k1) - k1;
00940   }
00941 
00942   // Coefficients, z[k], of sine series to convert sigma to zeta
00943   void Geodesic::zetCoeff(real k1, real z[]) throw() {
00944     real
00945       k2 = sq(k1),
00946       d = k1;
00947     switch (nzet) {
00948     case 0:
00949       break;
00950     case 1:
00951       z[0] = d/2;
00952       break;
00953     case 2:
00954       z[0] = d/2;
00955       d *= k1;
00956       z[1] = 3*d/16;
00957       break;
00958     case 3:
00959       z[0] = d*(k2+8)/16;
00960       d *= k1;
00961       z[1] = 3*d/16;
00962       d *= k1;
00963       z[2] = 5*d/48;
00964       break;
00965     case 4:
00966       z[0] = d*(k2+8)/16;
00967       d *= k1;
00968       z[1] = d*(k2+6)/32;
00969       d *= k1;
00970       z[2] = 5*d/48;
00971       d *= k1;
00972       z[3] = 35*d/512;
00973       break;
00974     case 5:
00975       z[0] = d*(k2*(k2+2)+16)/32;
00976       d *= k1;
00977       z[1] = d*(k2+6)/32;
00978       d *= k1;
00979       z[2] = d*(15*k2+80)/768;
00980       d *= k1;
00981       z[3] = 35*d/512;
00982       d *= k1;
00983       z[4] = 63*d/1280;
00984       break;
00985     case 6:
00986       z[0] = d*(k2*(k2+2)+16)/32;
00987       d *= k1;
00988       z[1] = d*(k2*(35*k2+64)+384)/2048;
00989       d *= k1;
00990       z[2] = d*(15*k2+80)/768;
00991       d *= k1;
00992       z[3] = d*(7*k2+35)/512;
00993       d *= k1;
00994       z[4] = 63*d/1280;
00995       d *= k1;
00996       z[5] = 77*d/2048;
00997       break;
00998     case 7:
00999       z[0] = d*(k2*(k2*(41*k2+64)+128)+1024)/2048;
01000       d *= k1;
01001       z[1] = d*(k2*(35*k2+64)+384)/2048;
01002       d *= k1;
01003       z[2] = d*(k2*(69*k2+120)+640)/6144;
01004       d *= k1;
01005       z[3] = d*(7*k2+35)/512;
01006       d *= k1;
01007       z[4] = d*(105*k2+504)/10240;
01008       d *= k1;
01009       z[5] = 77*d/2048;
01010       d *= k1;
01011       z[6] = 429*d/14336;
01012       break;
01013     case 8:
01014       z[0] = d*(k2*(k2*(41*k2+64)+128)+1024)/2048;
01015       d *= k1;
01016       z[1] = d*(k2*(k2*(47*k2+70)+128)+768)/4096;
01017       d *= k1;
01018       z[2] = d*(k2*(69*k2+120)+640)/6144;
01019       d *= k1;
01020       z[3] = d*(k2*(133*k2+224)+1120)/16384;
01021       d *= k1;
01022       z[4] = d*(105*k2+504)/10240;
01023       d *= k1;
01024       z[5] = d*(33*k2+154)/4096;
01025       d *= k1;
01026       z[6] = 429*d/14336;
01027       d *= k1;
01028       z[7] = 6435*d/262144;
01029       break;
01030     default:
01031       STATIC_ASSERT(nzet >= 0 && nzet <= 8, "Bad value of nzet");
01032     }
01033   }
01034 
01035   // The scale factor, H, to convert eta to changes in lambda
01036   Math::real Geodesic::etaFactor(real f, real k1) throw() {
01037     real
01038       fp = (f - k1) / (1 - k1),
01039       nu = fp !=0 ? 2 * k1 / fp : 2, // Correct limit is mu / (1 - mu/2)
01040       nu2 = sq(nu);
01041     real g;
01042     switch (etaord) {
01043     case 0:
01044       g = 0;
01045       break;
01046     case 1:
01047       g = 1;
01048       break;
01049     case 2:
01050       g = 1;
01051       break;
01052     case 3:
01053       g = 1;
01054       break;
01055     case 4:
01056       g = (64-fp*sq(fp)*nu2)/64;
01057       break;
01058     case 5:
01059       g = (fp*sq(fp)*(-fp*sq(nu2)-16*nu2)+1024)/1024;
01060       break;
01061     case 6:
01062       g = (fp*sq(fp)*(fp*(4*fp*nu2-sq(nu2))-16*nu2)+1024)/1024;
01063       break;
01064     case 7:
01065       g = (fp*sq(fp)*(fp*(fp*(fp*nu2*((8-nu2)*nu2+32)+32*nu2)-8*sq(nu2))-128*
01066           nu2)+8192)/8192;
01067       break;
01068     case 8:
01069       g = (fp*sq(fp)*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*nu2*(nu2*(15*nu2+56)+384)+nu2*((128-16*
01070           nu2)*nu2+512))+512*nu2)-128*sq(nu2))-2048*nu2)+131072)/131072;
01071       break;
01072     default:
01073       STATIC_ASSERT(etaord >= 0 && etaord <= 8, "Bad value of etaord");
01074       g = 0;
01075     }
01076     return -f * (2 - f)/(2 - fp) * g;
01077   }
01078 
01079   // Coefficients, h[k], of sine series to convert sigma to eta
01080   void Geodesic::etaCoeff(real f, real k1, real h[]) throw() {
01081     real
01082       fp = (f - k1) / (1 - k1),
01083       nu = fp !=0 ? 2 * k1 / fp : 2, // Correct limit is mu / (1 - mu/2)
01084       nu2 = sq(nu);
01085     real s = 2 * k1, d = s;
01086     switch (neta) {
01087     case 0:
01088       break;
01089     case 1:
01090       h[0] = d/8;
01091       break;
01092     case 2:
01093       h[0] = d*(2-fp)/16;
01094       d *= s;
01095       h[1] = d/64;
01096       break;
01097     case 3:
01098       h[0] = d*(fp*(fp*(-nu2-16)-32)+64)/512;
01099       d *= s;
01100       h[1] = d*(4-3*fp)/256;
01101       d *= s;
01102       h[2] = 5*d/1536;
01103       break;
01104     case 4:
01105       h[0] = d*(fp*(fp*(-2*nu2+fp*(-nu2-16)-32)-64)+128)/1024;
01106       d *= s;
01107       h[1] = d*(fp*(fp*(-nu2-8)-24)+32)/2048;
01108       d *= s;
01109       h[2] = d*(10-9*fp)/3072;
01110       d *= s;
01111       h[3] = 7*d/8192;
01112       break;
01113     case 5:
01114       h[0] = d*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*((4-nu2)*nu2-32)-4*nu2-64)-8*nu2-128)-256)+512)/
01115              4096;
01116       d *= s;
01117       h[1] = d*(fp*(fp*(-nu2-2*fp-8)-24)+32)/2048;
01118       d *= s;
01119       h[2] = d*(fp*(fp*(-7*nu2-32)-144)+160)/49152;
01120       d *= s;
01121       h[3] = d*(7-7*fp)/8192;
01122       d *= s;
01123       h[4] = 21*d/81920;
01124       break;
01125     case 6:
01126       h[0] = d*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*(nu2*(3*nu2+32)-128)+(32-8*nu2)*nu2-256)-32*
01127              nu2-512)-64*nu2-1024)-2048)+4096)/32768;
01128       d *= s;
01129       h[1] = d*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*(40-7*nu2)*nu2-128)-64*nu2-512)-1536)+2048)/
01130              131072;
01131       d *= s;
01132       h[2] = d*(fp*(fp*(2*fp*nu2-7*nu2-32)-144)+160)/49152;
01133       d *= s;
01134       h[3] = d*(fp*(fp*(-3*nu2-8)-56)+56)/65536;
01135       d *= s;
01136       h[4] = d*(42-45*fp)/163840;
01137       d *= s;
01138       h[5] = 11*d/131072;
01139       break;
01140     case 7:
01141       h[0] = d*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*(nu2*((320-61*nu2)*nu2+1280)-4096)+nu2*
01142              (192*nu2+2048)-8192)+(2048-512*nu2)*nu2-16384)-2048*nu2-32768)-
01143              4096*nu2-65536)-131072)+262144)/2097152;
01144       d *= s;
01145       h[1] = d*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*(nu2*(37*nu2+192)+256)+(320-56*nu2)*nu2)-
01146              1024)-512*nu2-4096)-12288)+16384)/1048576;
01147       d *= s;
01148       h[2] = d*(fp*(fp*(fp*(fp*((560-91*nu2)*nu2+768)+256*nu2)-896*nu2-4096)-
01149              18432)+20480)/6291456;
01150       d *= s;
01151       h[3] = d*(fp*(fp*(fp*(23*nu2+40)-48*nu2-128)-896)+896)/1048576;
01152       d *= s;
01153       h[4] = d*(fp*(fp*(-165*nu2-240)-2880)+2688)/10485760;
01154       d *= s;
01155       h[5] = d*(88-99*fp)/1048576;
01156       d *= s;
01157       h[6] = 429*d/14680064;
01158       break;
01159     default:
01160       STATIC_ASSERT(neta >= 0 && neta <= 7, "Bad value of neta");
01161     }
01162   }
01163 } // namespace GeographicLib
